_meanings:
{@--3@} (In <ab>Rhet.</ab>) A figure
of speech, ‘Poetical fancy,’ which
consists in supposing {#upameya#} and {#upamAna#}
as similar to each other in some 
respects and in indicating, expressly
or by implication, a probability of
their identity based on such 
similarity; it is the imagining of one
object under the character of 
another; {#saMBAvanamaTotprekzA prakftasya pareRa#}
{#yat#} <ls>K. P. 10</ls>; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {#liMpatIva tamoMgAni#} 
{#vazaMtIvAMjanaM naBaH#} <ls>Mk. 1. 34</ls>; {#sTitaH pfTivyA iva#}
{#mAnadaMqaH#} <ls>Ku. 1. 1.</ls> It is usually 
expressed by {#iva#}, or by words like
{#manye, SaMke, DruvaM, prAyaH, nUnaM#} &c. (see  
<ls>Kāv. 2. 234</ls>); <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>S. D. 686-692</ls> and  
<ls>R. G.</ls> under {#utprekzA#} also.
